content.p: The Advanced Data Analysis Centre (ADAC) is housed within the Digital Research Service to provide data-driven research and innovation within academia and industry. ADAC has a proven track record of undertaking research on a range of projects. These range from small proof-of-concept studies with a handful of data points to large national data infrastructure projects. Since its foundation in 2012, ADAC has contributed to over 30 publications and has been involved in over £45M of research funding bids. ADAC’s expertise spans a range of disciplines in the fields of Data Analytics and Bioinformatics. The Advanced Data Analysis Centre is closely partnered with the Digital Research Service who are able to participate in collaborative projects, bringing expertise in a range of data analysis disciplines. Enquiries for research project collaboration with ADAC are handled through the Digital Research Service Portal. Research Project Enquiries For any other query, please email us: General Enquiries ADAC was a joint initiative between the School of Computer Science and the School of Veterinary Medicine and Science. We have since grown and became known as Digital Research Service, part of DTS. Please see our Contact Us page for telephone and email contact points
